00019 /*
00020  * Simple example of using file5 wrapper around hdf5. Note that for robust code
00021  * more checking of error return values and write sizes should be done, but they
00022  * are omitted in this example for clarity.
00023  */
00024 #include <iostream>
00025 #include "file5/File5.h"
00026 
00027 using namespace affx;
00028 using namespace std;
00029 
00030 /* Write some example data to the file. */
00031 void  writeSomeData(affx::File5_Tsv *file) {
00032   /* File format definition - Tell this file what columns will be
00033      present and what types they are. */
00034   file->defineColumn(0,0,"probeset", FILE5_DTYPE_STRING, 10);
00035   file->defineColumn(0,1,"value", FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
00036   
00037   /* Example data. */
00038   string probesets[] = {"ps1","ps2","ps3"};
00039   double values[] = {0.1,0.2,0.3};
00040   
00041   /* Write data out into file. */
00042   for(int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00043     file->set_string(0,0,probesets[i]);
00044     file->set_d(0,1,values[i]);
00045     file->writeLevel(0);
00046   }
00047 
00048   // reset to beginning of file.
00049   file->rewind();
00050 
00051 }
00052 
00053 /* Just print out a simple string, double file. */
00054 void dumpSimpleFile(affx::File5_Tsv *file) {
00055   string s;
00056   float fval;
00057   int  ival;
00058   double val;
00059   int status = 0;
00060   while (file->nextLevel(0) == FILE5_OK) {
00061     status = file->get(0, 0, &s);
00062     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00063       exit(1); 
00064     }
00065     cout << "As string: " << s << endl;
00066     status = file->get(0, 0, &fval);
00067     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00068       exit(1); 
00069     }
00070     cout << "As float: " << fval << endl;
00071     status = file->get(0, 1, &val);
00072     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00073       exit(1); 
00074     }
00075     status = file->get(0, 1, &ival);
00076     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00077       exit(1); 
00078     }
00079     cout << "As int: " << ival << endl;
00080     cout << s << "\t" << val << endl;
00081   }
00082 }
00083 
00084 /* Demo reading a file */
00085 void openAndReadOnly() {
00086     affx::File5_File hdf5;
00087     affx::File5_Group *group = NULL;
00088 
00089     // Open and initialize the hdf5 file 'simple-example.hd5'. 
00090     int status = hdf5.open("simple-example.hd5", affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00091     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00092       cout << "Bad open" << endl;
00093       exit(1);
00094     }
00095 
00096     // Open the /some-data group, like a directory within the file
00097     group = hdf5.openGroup("some-data", affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00098 
00099     // Open a 'tsv file' within that group. Like opening a tsv file called /some-data/some-file 
00100     affx::File5_Tsv *file = NULL;
00101     file  = group->openTsv("some-file", affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00102   
00103     // Write out some example data
00104     cout << "Doing first file" << endl;
00105     dumpSimpleFile(file);
00106 
00107     // Open another 'tsv file' within that group. Like opening a tsv file called /some-data/some-other-file 
00108     affx::File5_Tsv *otherFile = NULL;
00109     otherFile  = group->openTsv("some-other-file", affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00110   
00111     // Read some example data
00112     cout << "Doing second file" << endl;
00113     dumpSimpleFile(otherFile);
00114 
00115     // Cleanup
00116     file->close();
00117     delete file;
00118     otherFile->close();
00119     delete otherFile;
00120     group->close();
00121     delete group;
00122     hdf5.close();
00123 }
00124 
00125 /* Demo writing file */
00126 void openAndWriteData() {
00127     affx::File5_File hdf5;
00128     affx::File5_Group *group = NULL;
00129     
00130     // Open and initialize the hdf5 file 'simple-example.hd5'. 
00131     int status = hdf5.open("simple-example.hd5", affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE | affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00132     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00133       cout << "Bad open" << endl;
00134       exit(1);
00135     }
00136 
00137     // Open the /some-data group, like a directory within the file
00138     group = hdf5.openGroup("some-data", affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE);
00139 
00140     // Open a 'tsv file' within that group. Like opening a tsv file called /some-data/some-file 
00141     affx::File5_Tsv *file = NULL;
00142     file  = group->openTsv("some-file", affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE);
00143   
00144     // Write out some example data
00145     cout << "Doing first file" << endl;
00146     writeSomeData(file);
00147 
00148     // Open another 'tsv file' within that group. Like opening a tsv file called /some-data/some-other-file 
00149     affx::File5_Tsv *otherFile = NULL;
00150     otherFile  = group->openTsv("some-other-file", affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE);
00151   
00152     // Read some example data
00153     cout << "Doing second file" << endl;
00154     writeSomeData(otherFile);
00155 
00156     // Cleanup
00157     file->close();
00158     delete file;
00159     otherFile->close();
00160     delete otherFile;
00161     group->close();
00162     delete group;
00163     hdf5.close();
00164 }
00165 
00166 /* Print usage and quit. */
00167 void usage() {
00168   cout << "simple-file5-example - creates or reads an example hdf5 file\n"
00169   "using affymetrix file5 libraries. Try bashing the simple-example.hd5\n"
00170   "with a hex editor and you'll see that the correct results are produced\n"
00171   "or an error is reported.\n"
00172   "usage:\n"
00173   "   #create an example file\n"
00174   "   simple-fil5-example write\n"
00175   "   #read the example file\n"
00176     "   simple-file5-example read\n";
00177   exit(1);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /* Everybody's favorite function. Example usage*/
00181 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00182   string read("read");
00183   string write("write");
00184   if(argc != 2)
00185     usage();
00186   // read data
00187   if(argv[1] == read) {
00188     openAndReadOnly();
00189   }
00190   // write the data
00191   else if(argv[1] == write) {
00192     openAndWriteData();
00193   }
00194   else {
00195     usage();
00196   }
00197   return 0;
00198 }
